title.narrative: Winterization for returning IDPS and communities in Aleppo

description.narrative: Overall objective: To contribute to improved well-being and living conditions of vulnerable boys and girls in Aleppo (Dayr Hafer area) during winter. SO: To provide highly vulnerable families in Aleppo with essential winterization items to maintain their health, privacy & dignity.

Seven years into the crisis, the scale, severity, and complexity of needs across Syria remain deep and far-reaching. Over half of the country’s population have fled their homes: 5.5 million people have sought refuge in the region and beyond, and 6.1 million people are internally displaced. 13.1 million people remain in need of humanitarian assistance. Of these, 5.6 million people face acute humanitarian needs. Millions of people have fallen into poverty with many forced to resort to harmful coping strategies and faced with increasing protection risks. Many Syrian’s live of USD 50 a month insufficient to feed and dress a family whilst rehabilitating the many destroyed homes, let alone spend any money of heating or medicines. With winter quickly approaching, which is expected to be a very harsh one, humanitarian needs are likely to further increase.
Vulnerable boys and girls in Aleppo (Dayr Hafer area).

description.narrative: Distribution of Non-Food Items. All household materials excluding those that fall under hygiene/dignity kits or direct shelter items. Also excludes unrestricted cash, which is to be put under indicator CSH-I1 or CSH-I2. However, if cash is provided for the purpose of buying household items, it should be put under this indicator (i.e. restricted cash).
